meanings.definition: A long, narrow cut or depression in a surface.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter carved intricate grooves into the wood.
meanings.sent2: The tire tracks left deep grooves in the mud.
meanings.sent3: The grooves on the vinyl record made the music sound like a bumpy road.
meanings.sent4: Her smile formed deep grooves on her cheeks, like dimples.
meanings.sent5: The grooves on the tree bark resembled tiny canyons, creating a unique texture.

meanings.definition: A fixed routine or pattern of behavior.
meanings.sent1: Every morning, he followed the same grooves: wake up, brush teeth, eat breakfast.
meanings.sent2: Her grooves of daily exercise and healthy eating kept her fit.
meanings.sent3: His grooves of telling jokes at the wrong time always lightened the mood.
meanings.sent4: The grooves of tradition guided their family gatherings every holiday.
meanings.sent5: The grooves of his speech pattern were comforting, like a familiar melody.

meanings.definition: A spiral track cut in a phonograph record, into which the stylus fits.
meanings.sent1: The needle followed the grooves on the vinyl, playing the music.
meanings.sent2: The grooves on the record guided the needle to produce sound.
meanings.sent3: The DJ joked that the grooves on the record were like a musical maze.
meanings.sent4: As the record spun, the grooves whispered the secrets of the music.
meanings.sent5: The grooves on the vinyl were like a hidden language, speaking to those who listened closely.
